intro: Schoepfia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf schoepfia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive velvety texture. Its yellow flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oval fruits known as cypsela. Schoepfia velutina is often found in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
